titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2333) to authorize appropriations for the Department of State, the United States Information Agency, and related agencies, to authorize appropriations for foreign assistance programs, and for other purposes, and the bill (H.R. 2404) to authorize appropriations for foreign assistance programs, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 103-130, by Mr. Hall (OH).

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2333 and H.R. 2404 with 1 hour of general debate. Upon adoption of this rule it shall be in order for the Speaker to declare the House resolved into the Committee of the Whole House for the separate consideration of the bills. All points of order against consideration of the bills shall be waived. At the conclusion of general debate on each bill, the Committee of the Whole shall rise without motion. No further consideration of either bill shall be in order except pursuant to a subsequent order of the House.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 50.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/14/1993--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of: (1) H.R. 2333 (authorizing appropriations for the Department of State, the United States Information Agency, related agencies, and foreign assistance programs); and (2) H.R. 2404 (authorizing appropriations for foreign assistance programs).
